page.title: 05Employment in Ballingry
page.content:
{ 100}senior pupils were asked,"Where does the main breadwinner in the family go to work?" The results were:
Local {8} Kirkcaldy {5} Dunfermline {8} Lochgelly {3} Glenrothes {2} Rosyth Dockyard {13} Cowdenbeath{21} Other {14} There were{26}unemployed.
Locally, there are not many shops for people to work in, but there is the gas plant and open-cast mine at Westfield. Cowdenbeath, where the biggest number work, has shops and factories and there is a good bus service. Although Glenrothes is a big town, has lots of factories and is not far, there is no public transport from Ballingry. Derek Smith and Alan Mackie (9)
